ygData.subject: Cantera compilation problem
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I m trying to install Cantera on my Linux machine and when I run the configure script, I get the following messages: checking for Fortran 77 libraries...

From: "jo_vark" <jo_vark@...>
Subject: Cantera compilation problem
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=148663252
X-Yahoo-Profile: jo_vark
X-eGroups-Approved-By: dggoodwin <dgoodwin@...> via web; 18 May 2005 22:14:23 -0000

Hi,
I'm trying to install Cantera on my Linux machine and when I run the
configure script, I get the following messages:

checking for Fortran 77 libraries...  -L/usr/lib64 
-L/usr/lib/gcc-lib/x86_64-redhat-linux/3.2.3
-L/usr/lib/gcc-lib/x86_64-redhat-linux/3.2.3/../../../../lib64
-L/usr/lib/gcc-lib/x86_64-redhat-linux/3.2.3/../../.. -L/lib/../lib64
-L/usr/lib/../lib64 -lfrtbegin -lg2c -lm -lgcc_s
The Fortran 77 libraries on this platform are not correctly determined by
the configuration process. They are being manually set to
FLIBS = -L/usr/lib64 -L/usr/lib/gcc-lib/x86_64-redhat-linux/3.2.3
-L/usr/lib/gcc-lib/x86_64-redhat-linux/3.2.3/../../../../lib64
-L/usr/lib/gcc-lib/x86_64-redhat-linux/3.2.3/../../.. -L/lib/../lib64
-L/usr/lib/../lib64 -lfrtbegin -lg2c -lm -lgcc_s
checking Fortran 90 compiler (f95) type... none
   -> cannot build the Fortran 90 interface
checking SO... .so

Later when I run make, I get the following error:

running build_ext
building 'Cantera._cantera' extension
creating build/temp.linux-x86_64-2.2
gcc -DNDEBUG -O2 -g -pipe -D_GNU_SOURCE -fPIC -fPIC
-I../../build/include -Isrc -I../clib/src -I/usr/include/python2.2 -c
src/pycantera.cpp -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-2.2/pycantera.o
gcc -shared build/temp.linux-x86_64-2.2/pycantera.o
-L/home/jo_vark/Cantera/cantera-1.5.5r3/build/lib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
-L/home/jo_vark/Cantera/cantera-1.5.5r3/build/lib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
-lclib -lzeroD -loneD -ltransport -lcantera -lrecipes -lctlapack
-lctblas -lctmath -lcvode -ltpx -lstdc++ -lg2c -lm -o
build/lib.linux-x86_64-2.2/Cantera/_cantera.so
/usr/bin/ld:
/home/jo_vark/Cantera/cantera-1.5.5r3/build/lib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/libzeroD.a(Reactor.o):
relocation R_X86_64_32 can not be used when making a shared object;
recompile with -fPIC
/home/jo_vark/Cantera/cantera-1.5.5r3/build/lib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/libzeroD.a:
could not read symbols: Bad value
collect2: ld returned 1 exit status
error: command 'gcc' failed with exit status 1
make[1]: *** [_build] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory
`/home/jo_vark/Cantera/cantera-1.5.5r3/Cantera/python'
make: *** [python] Error 2

I tried setting the environment variable CXXFLAGS to -fPIC, but that
didn't help.
Any ideas?

Thanks in Advance,
Jo
